FuncDef:
The tunnel timeout command sets a timeout period for L2TP packet retransmission.
The undo tunnel timeout command resets the timeout period for L2TP packet retransmission to the default value.
By default, the timeout period for L2TP packet retransmission is 2 seconds.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the timeout period for L2TP packet retransmission.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 10, in seconds.

ExtraInfo:
After the device sends an L2TP packet to the peer through an L2TP tunnel, if no response is received within the time-out period, the device retransmits the packet.
If a large number of L2TP tunnels are established, it is recommended that the timeout period for L2TP packet retransmission be set to 5 seconds.
